column4: i can give u info u need to help me because i am on a wireless right now i don't necesarrily want to restart
sure what kind of info?
whatever info u need to figure out what is wrong
sounds like SeaPhor might be able to guide you better.. I wouldn't know where to start
thanks for trying :)
np.. wish I could have helped more.
you have to mount the drive in the live cd to do that then you have to find the mount point to copy the xorg to.

SeaPhor sometimes it's easier not to use the live cd.. just go to Places/File system and look in /etc/X11/ for an older copy.. If it was done automatically it will be dated.. just copy that back to xorg.conf
SeaPhor also you could just install ibex now since it's in RC and do the daily updates..
RC?

SeaPhor one thing to do on a reinstall is to make sure you create a seperate /home partition for all your date.. that way if you really mess things up and need to reinstall you can without loosing all your data.. I experienced that in the last week with a failed harddrive.
RC=release candidate.. it's the release just before the official release with most of the bugs worked out.
don't do update.. do a reinstall.
how would i do that?
download the new iso and burn it.. put it in the cd rom and restart the machine.. on boot it will have an install button after getting to the gui
so don't do it through update manger? and i won't lose files or have to repartition?

if you currently have a seperate /home partition then no you won't if you don't format it as part of the install.. if your /home is part and parcel with your root directory now then you'll loose it unless you move it before installing.
ok
maybe.. open synaptic and go to edit then choose Fix Broken Packages
try again after closing synaptic
all i have open is update manager? and it won't really close
that's what you need to close
